source_sentence: 先奉獻十方諸佛百千俱胝萬億那由侘不可說不可說國土微塵等一切冥宦冥道僧尼靈界五百餓鬼眾半天婆羅門諸餓鬼眾。
translation: We first present to the buddhas of the ten directions a hundred thousand koṭīs, a thousand million nayutas, ineffable, ineffable lands, and so forth, all the hungry eunuchs, nuns, monks, and spirits of the spiritual realm, five hundred hungry ghosts, and the Brahmins of the half-deva world, all the hungry ghosts.

source_sentence: 一一各得摩伽陀國十六斛食。
translation: Each one of them receives 16 liters of food from the land of Magadha.

translation: If he wants to liberate himself from the spells of evil people and enemies, he can offer it to the four Brahmakāyika gods.

source_sentence: 又別可供大梵天王四天王位即得解脫。
translation: He can also make offerings specifically to the four heavenly kings of Brahmā, who will then be liberated.

translation: He can make offerings to the 28 great yakṣas (Vaiśravaṇa's retinue) who want to save the life of righteous retribution.

translation: The ācārya summons all the dragons and spirits of that place to make offerings (separate seats) at his own will.

source_sentence: 常以新衣壇中穿一穴置新衣。
